category: Sports Fair Committee Regulations/Article 35 (Procedures for dealing with acts that disrupt the order of play during competitions)
contents: Article 35 (Procedures for dealing with acts that disrupt the order of play during competitions) ① If the sports association that hosts the competition pursuant to Article 25, Paragraph 1, Item 7 recognizes a violation, the person suspected of disciplinary action is notwithstanding Article 36, Paragraph 1. Cannot participate in the competition immediately after the report is received until the event committee, city/provincial committee, or committee decides on disciplinary action. Revised on October 23, 2020. ② The relevant organization must immediately notify the person suspected of disciplinary action of the holding of the sports committee, city/provincial committee, or committee immediately after the occurrence of the act. ③ The relevant organization must hold a sports committee or city/provincial committee within 48 hours after notification pursuant to paragraph 2. ④ The sports committee, city/provincial committee, or committee must provide the person suspected of disciplinary action and the relevant parties an opportunity to make a statement. However, an exception may be made if the person concerned refuses this. ⑤ If disciplinary action is decided by the sports committee, city/provincial committee, or committee, the relevant organization shall notify the person suspected of disciplinary action and the head of the organization to which he or she is affiliated with a written decision in Form No. 3. ⑥ If a person suspected of disciplinary action is dissatisfied with the disciplinary decision under paragraph 5, he or she may apply for reconsideration in accordance with the reconsideration procedure specified in Article 34. In this case, notwithstanding Article 36 (1), the effect of disciplinary action shall not be suspended. ⑦ If it is difficult to convene a committee during a competition under paragraphs 1 to 6, the head of the organization hosting the competition may form and operate a temporary committee (order countermeasures committee, etc.). However, the requirements for forming a temporary committee may be different from those for the committee. Revised January 24, 2022. ⑧ The actions of the Temporary Committee under Paragraph 7 are limited to emergency restrictions such as restrictions on participation in the relevant competition. ⑨ In case of disciplinary action based on the actions of the temporary committee, the relevant organization committee must carry out the disciplinary action within 30 days after the end of the competition, and the related reconsideration procedure shall follow the reconsideration procedure specified in Article 34. Revised 2022. 1. 24.
